Jul 23 - First Sentier Investors-backed Evos is acquiring the Amsterdam, Terneuzen, Ghent and Malta bulk liquid terminals from Oiltanking and affiliates of 3i Infrastructure that are selling their respective 55% and 45% stakes. The acquisition will be financed by a capital increase and debt funding. The deal will further Evos and FSI’s vision of creating a tank storage platform with presence in the key European liquid bulk hubs, it said. Liquid bulk storage company Evos was founded in 2019 and is owned by investment funds managed by FSI. Evos operates a network of tank terminals in Europe including Rotterdam, Amsterdam, Hamburg and Algeciras, with combined storage capacity of 2.5m cubic metres.
